summary: This bill, H.R. 2655, proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to eliminate the federal income tax on unemployment compensation. The amendment would strike the existing provision regarding this tax and replace it with language stating that the tax will not apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024. The changes made by this section shall apply to amounts received after December 31, 2024, in taxable years ending after that date.
